title.bold: Guideline for the development of a grievance mechanism to prevent, detect and respond to gender-based violence (GBV), including sexual exploitation, abuse, and harassment (SEAH) internally as well as in engagement with external stakeholders

p.bold: Note to entry: See definitions for different types of Gender Based Violence

app.p: An organisation should have a grievance mechanism in place to prevent, detect and respond to risks of gender-based violence, including sexual exploitation, abuse and harassment (hereafter referred to as gender-based violence or GBV). Depending on organisational activities such mechanism may be put in place to deal with both internal and/or external cases.
In the following paragraphs, one can find a guidance on what such grievance mechanisms are about, why they are useful, and how to develop and implement them.
